intro: Psephellus marschallianus, commonly known as the marshmallow plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant is also valued for its mucilage-rich roots, which have been used in traditional medicine.
